channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump ordered to restore millions in frozen science funding to UCLA
item.description: The school’s chancellor said last week that the Trump administration has pulled $584 million in federal grants from various federal agencies.

item.title: Steve Jobs’ first Silicon Valley boss turned down an offer to buy a third of Apple for $50,000—today, his share would be worth nearly $1 trillion
item.description: Atari cofounder Nolan Bushnell missed out on becoming a trillionaire because he snubbed an offer from his ex-employee, the late Steve Jobs.

item.title: Taylor Swift’s podcast appearance breaks Trump record, nearly doubling his viewership
item.description: Trump appeared on the Joe Rogan Experience last October.

item.title: The mighty American consumer keeps shrugging off tariffs as retail sales rise 0.5% in July
item.description: Retail sales rose 0.5% last month, maching economists' estimates.

item.title: Michael Saylor bets on a $100 billion Bitcoin ‘credit’ dream
item.description: Michael Saylor, cofounder and executive chairman of Strategy, is asking his loyal following of retail investors to embrace perpetual preferred stocks.

item.title: How Netflix struck gold on the Billboard charts with ‘KPop Demon Hunters’
Dow industrials targeting 250-point advance after economic data — live updates
Dow up 200 points at open as blue-chip gauge hunts first record close this year
